Toast the Coast before the Coast is Toast!

Toast the Coast!

Before the coast is toast

Saturday June 13th

Jericho Beach

RSVP now

Celebrating the Coast

Bring your family, friends and a no waste picnic and join us for a beachside celebration of this beautiful coastline! Come Toast the Coast and send a message to Harper that people — not oil — belong on these beaches. This event will be taking place on unceded Coast Salish Territory of the Xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ (Tsleil-Waututh) nations.

FREE, Everyone is welcome.

Protecting the Coast

Tankers. Pipelines. Oil slicks on the beach.

As if this beautiful coast wasn't facing enough threats, Shell is right now moving its Arctic fleet into position to begin drilling for oil in Alaska's ice-covered waters — oil they want to eventually ship in super-tankers South along the coast.

We'll Bring the Jam!

Live music including Giraffe Aftermath, Viper Central, Sandy Scofield, Monica Lee Band, Ta’Kaiya Blaney, Corrina Keeling, Rap battle roasters featuring: MANIK and Bearodactyl and more!!

This is a no waste event: Bring your own reusable water bottles, plates, utensils. BYOToast and we’ll bring the jam!

Connect

Meet the community! Partner organizations are bringing interactive tabling displays, games, and short workshops building off the coastal and beach party theme!

Come learn, play, and meet environmental and social justice leaders from all backgrounds.

Interactive Art

Renowned Northwest-Coastal First Nations artist Roy Henry Vickers has designed a unique salmon print that’s being transformed into a 9-foot floating lantern made from salvaged materials.

Another large scale participatory art piece needs you to help reveal a hidden message! From sand artists to poetry, this event has a distinctly creative flavour! All artists welcome!
